On Jul 15, 2010, at 9:36 AM, Ant=F3nio Mota wrote:

> But don't drive peop=
le away based on purity issues.

Question is: Do people understand the cons=
equences of relaxing a constraint?

If you do and can live with the resulti=
ng loss of guaranteed system properties, fine. Go ahead.

OTH, relaxing the=
 stateless server constraint at the cost of lost scalability and much reduc=
ed understandability will not make adopters of REST happy in the long run.
=

I'll argue for purity every time. And I really do not see any problem with=
 doing pure REST anyhow.

Jan
